title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki - XWiki
content:
00:23 <SvenDowideit> has quit  
00:23 <SvenDowideit> has joined #xwiki  
00:50 <lucaa> has quit  
01:23 <abusenius> has quit

04:25 <DrLou> has quit  
06:00 <Denis> has quit  
06:08 <Denis> has joined #xwiki  
06:23 <venkatesh> has joined #xwiki  
06:27 <venkatesh> has quit  
06:27 <venkatesh> has joined #xwiki  
07:26 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
07:28 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
08:21 <sburjan`> has quit  
08:21 <sburjan`> has joined #xwiki  
08:35 <jstoldt> has joined #xwiki  
08:39 <jstoldt> good morning :)  
08:49 <lucaa> has joined #xwiki  
09:09 <lucaa> has quit  
09:12 <sburjan> has joined #xwiki  
09:20 <+sburjan> hello vmassol. Can i port some tests from selenium to ui today ?  
09:20 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
09:41 <arkub> has joined #xwiki  
09:41 <florinciu> has joined #xwiki  
09:55 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
10:02 <lucaa> has joined #xwiki  
10:07 <arkub> has quit  
10:08 <arkub> has joined #xwiki  
10:12 <evalica> has quit  
10:15 <sdumitriu> has joined #xwiki  
10:19 <vmassol> sburjan: hi sorin. I think you should check with Silvia since you're part of her team.  
10:19 <+sburjan> she;s ok  
10:19 <+sburjan> i never check with you until I check with her first  
10:20 <vmassol> ok  
10:20 <vmassol> just attach your patch to a jira issue as usual then  
10:20 <+sburjan> ok  
10:20 <+sburjan> I'm still looking for a test to migrate  
10:20 <vmassol> don't take InlineEditorTest since I'm finishing it this morning  
10:20 <+sburjan> I know  
10:21 <+sburjan> I see some duplicated tests selenium - ui eg (LoginLogoutTest, WYSIWYGEditorTest)  
10:46 <jstoldt> O\_o i just upgraded a test environment of mine to 3.0 snapshot and the adminstration app is all messed up  
10:47 <@sdumitriu> Try a cache refresh  
10:47 <+tmortagne> jstoldt: did you upgraded the xar too ?  
10:47 <jstoldt> yep  
10:47 <vmassol> refresh cache?  
10:47 <jstoldt> i just rolled back some files after checking the diffs  
10:47 <jstoldt> ah, that was it  
10:47 <jstoldt> thanks vmassol  
10:47 <+tmortagne> then probably cache issue as sdumitriu said  
10:48 <jstoldt> n'ah, i use opera  
10:48 <jstoldt> that one is doing a lot of caching, so i expect that was the problem  
10:48 <jstoldt> but i got something uggly for you  
10:48 <+sburjan> vmassol: I will migrate DeletePage  
10:48 <jstoldt> uploading, hold on  
10:49 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
10:50 <jstoldt> http://img560.imageshack.us/img560/3583/textugly.png  
10:50 <Enygma`> has joined #xwiki  
10:50 <jstoldt> this might be fairly unique to German because we just kind of chain nouns together until we get 50+ char compound nouns...  
10:53 <@sdumitriu> Lebensmittelladung?  
10:53 <jstoldt> yeah  
10:53 <vmassol> guys when can we start the release?  
10:54 <vmassol> seems like last functional tests did not run on hudson: http://hudson.xwiki.org/view/Functional%20Tests/job/xwiki-product-enterprise-tests/361/console  
10:54 <jstoldt> although Lebensmittelladung is not too common in Germany... we don't have a lot of trouble obtaining food so we don't need lorries to bring it to us, if you know what i'm saying ;)  
10:59 <jstoldt> sdumitriu: should i file a complaint a.k.a. issue?  
11:00 <jstoldt> or is this a "won't fix, get better grammar" kind of thing?  
11:00 <rrodriguez> has joined #xwiki  
11:03 <vmassol> jstoldt: file a jira  
11:03 <jstoldt> oki doki  
11:05 <jstoldt> is it 1.45?  
11:06 <@sdumitriu> No, it's 1.46  
11:06 <@sdumitriu> You're between releases  
11:06 <jstoldt> okay, i'll put in unknown  
11:06 <vmassol> it's not unknown  
11:06 <@sdumitriu> So you can either wait a bit, or just add a comment to the existing issue  
11:06 <jstoldt> oh there is 1.46  
11:06 <jstoldt> my bad  
11:06 <@sdumitriu> Or use 1.46, since I won't have time to fix it now  
11:07 <jstoldt> sure  
11:08 <jstoldt> Errors: java.io.IOException: No space left on device  
11:08 <jstoldt> say whaaaaatttttttt???  
11:08 <@sdumitriu> Ah, right  
11:09 <+mflorea> jstoldt: I already reported it, let's hope someone can fix it  
11:09 <@sdumitriu> We need a sysadmin to be online  
11:09 <jstoldt> so what should i do now? just keep the window open and hope i can report this later?  
11:10 <+sburjan> no :) .. the session will exprite and you'll have to rewrite the text. Save the text somewhere :)  
11:10 <+sburjan> \*expire  
11:10 <jstoldt> lucky me! :-D  
11:12 <@sdumitriu> No it won't  
11:12 <jstoldt> it usually does for me... IBM proxies...  
11:12 <@sdumitriu> The session will expire, but the form data is saved  
11:13 <+sburjan> sdumitriu: mine isn't  
11:13 <+sburjan> I have to login again, etc etc  
11:13 <jstoldt> anyway, please leave me a message when i can post the issue  
11:14 <jstoldt> also, might there be a way to post the updated translation to the svn on a regular basis so they are included in snapshot builds? that might be handy  
11:18 <+mflorea> guys, I found one issue: The form on Panels.NewPage doesn't have an input for the template, and if there are registered template providers then when you submit the form you are not taken to the edit page but the to a form where you have to pick the template. NewPagePanelTest.testCreatePageFromPanel doesn't take this into account. Is this the expected behavior?  
11:19 <@sdumitriu> It's acceptable  
11:22 <+mflorea> in this case I have to update the test. The problem is that there are two behaviors (1) when there are template providers registered and (2) when there aren't any. I guess I can check in the test what page is loaded and submit the additional information if required  
11:25 <@sdumitriu> jstoldt: Can you try Jira now?  
11:25 <jstoldt> XAADMINISTRATION-217  
11:27 <+mflorea> what's annoying is that there are many ui-test that flicker, and I don't see anything wrong with them. I just hope there isn't any bug in selenium. For instance, in SchedulerTest.testSchedulerJobDefaultEditMode there is a click to edit a page and an assert to check if a text is present. If I run the test 10 times it may fail once. If I get the page source before the assert, it never fails..  
11:28 <@sdumitriu> I think you can start the release  
11:29 <+mflorea> did you look at the escape test that is failing?  
11:29 <+mflorea> I haven't  
11:33 <@sdumitriu> I tried to fix it  
11:33 <@sdumitriu> It says it's a circula redirect, but I don't see how  
11:33 <@sdumitriu> It works locally  
11:37 <+mflorea> ok, I'll go eat something and start the release after  
11:48 <+sburjan> vmassol: hardcore question. http://svn.xwiki.org/svnroot/xwiki/enterprise/trunk/distribution-test/ui-tests/src/test/it/org/xwiki/test/ui/framework/elements/ViewPage.java We have a method called deleteCurrentPage(). Check also the comment from above it. I added my own method, that is called the same, so we have a naming conflict. What should I do ? I either rename my method, or rename the older method ?  
11:48 <+sburjan> also don't know what name to use, because I try to keep a consistency between copyCurrentPage() and deleteCurrentPage()  
11:49 <+sburjan> the method we have now it'a a full-featured action, it deletes an entire doc . and it's not a test  
11:49 <vmassol> sburjan: the todo is wrong  
11:50 <jvdrean> has joined #xwiki  
11:50 <florinciu> has quit  
11:50 <vmassol> ViewPage represents a page and all methodes MUST represent user actions the way the users does them  
11:50 <jvdrean> Hi!  
11:51 <vmassol> TestUtil can have shortcuts but ViewPage is a Page Object  
11:51 <+sburjan> vmassol: so I am allowed to remove it ? .. and re-imlpement it as a test ?  
11:51 <vmassol> errr?  
11:51 <vmassol> ViewPage is a page Object  
11:51 <+sburjan> i know  
11:51 <vmassol> it represents the common actions between all view pages  
11:51 <vmassol> in the UI there' s a delete page  
11:51 <vmassol> so why would you want to remove it?  
11:51 <jvdrean> I'm trying to make xwiki work as a portlet in liferay, the portlet is deployed correctly, but I have a problem during the first request with Hibernate  
11:52 <jvdrean> tons of org.hibernate.ObjectNotFoundException: No row with the given identifier exists: [com.xpn.xwiki.doc.XWikiDocument#482909206]  
11:52 <jvdrean> (mflorea ;) )  
11:52 <+sburjan> vmassol: because I'm writing a test that uses the ui to delete a page. Like hover over page, click delete, then click yes on the confirmation  
11:52 <jvdrean> given that the log says that the mysql driver is loaded and that all the tables are found  
11:52 <vmassol> sburjan: I don't understand your logic  
11:53 <+sburjan> vmassol: I am writing a \_test\_ to delete a page. My test would use the actual UI, like go there, click there, etc  
11:53 <vmassol> sburjan: tests MUST use Page objects to implement the tests  
11:53 <+sburjan> i know  
11:53 <vmassol> so whatt's the pb?  
11:54 <+sburjan> in the ViewPage, we have methods like : clickCopy, clickDelete, which return a Page Object  
11:54 <vmassol> sburjan: your tests will call ViewPage.deletePage() (BTW I don't like the current in the method name, it's useless)  
11:55 <+sburjan> vmassol: I am writing a \_test\_ that simulates all the actions of that method, but within a test, so I can use the UI by the book  
11:55 <+lucaa> vmassol: what's the recommended way to create a reference to a page in this wiki -- DocumentReference with only space and page filled in? Note that I want this to be a constant in my class, it's just a class name, and I would like it to refer to the current wiki.  
11:55 <vmassol> sburjan: I don't get it  
11:56 <vmassol> lucaa: DR is always absolute. what you should do is use a current provider if you need to get the current wiki  
11:56 <+sburjan> vmassol: check CopyPageTest.java. I am trying to do something analogically \_exact\_ for DeletePageTest  
11:56 <@sdumitriu> jstoldt: Are you here?  
11:57 <+lucaa> what does it mean a current provider?  
11:57 <+lucaa> resolver you mean?  
11:57 <vmassol> lucaa: starting project in IDE  
11:57 <+lucaa> as in I store it in serialized version "space.page" and then when i need to use it I resolve it with the current resolver?  
11:58 <vmassol> lucaa: see EntityReferenceValueProvider  
11:58 <+lucaa> I want a private static final to hold it  
11:58 <+mflorea> jvdrean: can you access the wiki directly? I could do this with WebSphere  
11:58 <vmassol> lucaa: you can use a "current" component impl of it and then do a new DocumentRef(provider.getValue(…), "space", "page")  
11:58 <jvdrean> mflorea: I can't  
11:59 <jvdrean> I mean not at the same time  
11:59 <vmassol> lucaa: the other option (which is less good IMO it's to use en Entity Reference Resolver to resolve a relative entity ref)  
11:59 <jvdrean> but I've tested the webapp successfuly in the same tomcat  
11:59 <jvdrean> (liferay uses tomcat)  
11:59 <+lucaa> vmassol: wouldn't that fix my value to the value of the provider at the moment of class load?  
11:59 <jvdrean> same libs, same configuration, same everything  
12:00 <vmassol> lucaa: that's the point of absolute reference… they're aboslute  
12:00 <+lucaa> vmassol: if I do  
12:00 <+lucaa> private static final ref = new DocumentRef(provider.getValue(…), "space", "page");  
12:00 <vmassol> if what you need is a relative one then it's different  
12:00 <+lucaa> ok, then I cannot store it as DR  
12:00 <vmassol> in that case you store an EntityReference  
12:00 <+lucaa> (I think I said I need a relative one in the first place)  
12:01 <+lucaa> DocumentRef is not an EntityRef?  
12:01 <vmassol> you didn't  
12:01 <+lucaa> or it is but is too much?  
12:01 <vmassol> DR is an ER  
12:01 <vmassol> but ER is not an DR  
12:01 <vmassol> and DR is a sepcial and \*valid\* ER  
12:01 <+lucaa> well yes, I kinda know that, what I didn't know is how special is the DR  
12:02 <vmassol> valid = it's a full valid reference which contains all parts specified  
12:02 <vmassol> s/specified/needed/  
12:02 <+lucaa> well, I might as well store it as a string and resolve it with the current resolver I already have in my class  
12:02 <vmassol> you can call it an absolute ref  
12:02 <vmassol> no string  
12:02 <vmassol> that's an antiapttern that we'r fixing  
12:02 <vmassol> s/an/the/  
12:03 <+lucaa> it seems to be the easiest to understand solution at this point  
12:03 <vmassol> you should never need to manipualte strings  
12:03 <+lucaa> (well I \_do\_ exagerate a bit here, to prove my point from last night)  
12:03 <+lucaa> ER it should be then  
12:03 <vmassol> doing parsing everytime you need it is 1) costly in perf and 2) dangerous since you're postponing the validity to later  
12:04 <+lucaa> I know we shouldn't use strings  
12:04 <+lucaa> in this case it's very straightforward, because it's a constant  
12:04 <vmassol> the recommendation is to use absolute refs as a strong preference. There are valid use cases for using relative refernces though  
12:04 <+lucaa> validity comes into play only if I'm idiot  
12:04 <+lucaa> as a dev  
12:05 <vmassol> not really  
12:05 <+lucaa> I write a piece of code that reads objects from a fixed xwiki class  
12:05 <vmassol> lots of things can happen  
12:05 <+lucaa> is that a good reason to use relative refs?  
12:05 <+lucaa> since I want the class in \_this wiki\_ not in the main wiki  
12:06 <vmassol> if you read objects then you can get the object ref as a ref  
12:06 <+lucaa> what?  
12:06 <+lucaa> XWikiDocument.getXObjects(DocumentReference classRef)  
12:06 <+lucaa> am I using the wrong API?  
12:06 <+lucaa> I need a doc ref for the class  
12:06 <+lucaa> I want it relative  
12:06 <+lucaa> am I thinking wrong?  
12:06 <vmassol> I don't know the api well but what I know is that XObject hold a ref to the document they belong to  
12:06 <vmassol> and I'm pretty sure I added a getDocuemntReference() in there  
12:07 <+lucaa> but I need to get the objs first, I'm not sure I understand  
12:07 <vmassol> hmm maybe I only added it for XClass  
12:09 <vmassol> what do you want to store?  
12:09 <+lucaa> I don't want to store, I want to read  
12:09 <+lucaa> the gadget objects in the current docujment  
12:09 <+lucaa> I grabbed the document  
12:09 <+lucaa> and now I need to getXObjects(gadget class)  
12:10 <abusenius> has joined #xwiki  
12:10 <jstoldt> sdumitriu: back  
12:10 <jstoldt> what is it you want?  
12:10 <+lucaa> gadget class has to be a DocumentReference, which I want to be relative to the current wiki  
12:10 <+lucaa> that's it  
12:10 <+lucaa> doesn't matter, i know how to do it  
12:10 <+lucaa> in a way or another  
12:11 <vmassol> well we don't have an api for that  
12:11 <+sburjan> bb in 30. vmassol, we'll continue then  
12:11 <vmassol> you can only get an XObject using a DR I think let me check  
12:12 <vmassol> yes you need a DR  
12:12 <+lucaa> and I'm fine with that  
12:12 <vmassol> (which is normal)  
12:12 <+lucaa> I just need to be able to store it as a constant in my class  
12:12 <+lucaa> and I cannot store it as a DR because I want it relative to the current wiki  
12:12 <vmassol> store the gadget class ref?  
12:13 <+lucaa> so, it's gonna be a  
12:13 <+lucaa> private static final EntityReference GADGET\_CLASS =  
12:13 <+lucaa>         new EntityReference("Gadget", EntityType.DOCUMENT, new EntityReference("XWiki", EntityType.SPACE));  
12:13 <+lucaa> yes, the gadget class ref  
12:13 <+lucaa> no?  
12:13 <vmassol> you should store it as DR IMO  
12:13 <+lucaa> and always point to the main wiki?  
12:13 <+lucaa> why?  
12:13 <vmassol> hmmm  
12:13 <vmassol> wait  
12:13 <+lucaa> because I think that's not gonna work  
12:14 <vmassol> this is in a macro right?  
12:14 <+lucaa> to get me the objects  
12:14 <+lucaa> yes  
12:14 <+lucaa> well, not really in a macro, in a class called by the macro  
12:14 <vmassol> yes you'll need to add the wiki at exec time since the current wiki depends where the macro is executed  
12:15 <vmassol> so your code above is correct  
12:16 <+lucaa> and I will need an currrentEntity resolver or some other fancy name it has to resolve it to a DR relative to current, at runtime  
12:16 <+lucaa> right?  
12:16 <vmassol> nope  
12:16 <+lucaa> no?  
12:16 <+lucaa> then?  
12:16 <vmassol> you can just do:  
12:17 <vmassol> hmm yes you're right it's easier. I was going to say you should use the value provider  
12:17 <vmassol> but since you're saving an ER you can do this:  
12:17 <vmassol> currentEntityRefernceResolver.resolve(GADGET\_CLASS)  
12:18 <vmassol> currentReferenceEntityReferenceResolver.resolve(GADGET\_CLASS) to be precise  
12:18 <+lucaa> EntityReferenceResolver with hint current, right?  
12:18 <vmassol> no  
12:19 <vmassol> "current/reference"  
12:19 <+lucaa> ok  
12:19 <vmassol> the resolver you're looking for  
12:19 <+lucaa> is there one with hint current?  
12:19 <vmassol> takes an ER as input and outputs a DR  
12:19 <+lucaa> yeah, I saw it now (I'm looking at class files)  
12:19 <vmassol> yes there's one "current" == "current/string"  
12:19 <+lucaa> aha  
12:19 <vmassol> takes a string as input  
12:19 <+lucaa> but it won't fit my params  
12:19 <+lucaa> ok  
12:19 <+lucaa> I see  
12:20 <vmassol> yes that's why you should use "current/reference"  
12:20 <vmassol> indeed  
12:20 <vmassol> actually you should use: CurrentReferenceDocumentReferenceResolver  
12:21 <vmassol> (since it outputs a DR)  
12:22 <+lucaa> but, to continue what I was saying last night, this is what I find complicated: finding what resolver you need, understanding that there are 2 types (from string from ref) and 4 types for each: WikiRef, DocRef, SpaceRef, AttachRef (for each string and ref). Having class names made of 5 words of which 2 are the same doesn't help.  
12:22 <+lucaa> I can understand it, in the end, and work with it, but when I don't have somebody to explain these diffs between all resolvers & stuff it's very very hard. This is what I tried to figure out last time I had trouble with this API  
12:22 <+lucaa> (is this good feedback?)  
12:22 <vmassol> maybe we need some doc?  
12:23 <+lucaa> sure, doc can solve the problem partially  
12:23 <vmassol> btw I created some here in case you don't kniw it: http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Model+Module  
12:24 <vmassol> one thing I can say is that we made a wrong assumption with Thomas when we designed the Reference API. We initially thought we wouldn't need realtive references so we added that later on (actually we didn't need to add anything but it means we haven't put the notion of Absolute/Relative in class names)  
12:25 <vmassol> the good thing with the api is that it's very terse when you know which resolver to use  
12:25 <vmassol> it's a one liner to resolve anything to a valid reference  
12:25 <abusenius> has quit  
12:25 <vmassol> we have several classes because there are 2 apis  
12:26 <vmassol> one generic one using EntityReference  
12:26 <+lucaa> as a feedback, I didn't learn much from the link you just sent me. To be understood as: "I knew what is there, and I still have troubles figuring it out"  
12:26 <vmassol> and a typed one using DR,, AR, etc  
12:26 <vmassol> yes it's not enough misingh things from it  
12:26 <vmassol> it does explain some stuff though  
12:26 <vmassol> it's covering the basic use cases  
12:27 <vmassol> but not the "advanced" ones  
12:27 <+lucaa> the general model I understand, I kinda know how it's supposed to work, but I still can't figure out how I should use it. Maybe it's normal that it's a hard API, but as long as you need it to get objects from a doc, it can be problematic  
12:27 <+lucaa> I mean when I look for stuff to use it, I still have troubles  
12:28 <+lucaa> we should write a wrapper for this, to cover very frequent cases or something  
12:28 <vmassol> btw in your case the problem  
12:28 <+lucaa> what I fear is that everybody will need to come on the IRC if they want to read the objects in a document  
12:28 <+lucaa> (I'm still thinking how to make it easy)  
12:28 <vmassol> is that the rendering api is made to be used outside of XWiki and thus we've had to use Strings instead of Reference  
12:29 <vmassol> we need to think about this in order to see if there's a way to improve that for those using it inside XWiki  
12:29 <+lucaa> ah yeah, that too  
12:29 <+lucaa> is a bit hard to deal with  
12:29 <+lucaa> you have strings, but for xwiki you cannot use them as string  
12:29 <+lucaa> s  
12:29 <+lucaa> it  
12:30 <+lucaa> it's a bit tough, and generates a looot of resolvers and serializers @Requirements  
12:30 <+lucaa> (see the annotations classes :) )  
12:30 <vmassol> for the rendering-api source doesn't mean anything  
12:30 <+lucaa> although that's a different case  
12:30 <vmassol> you can put whatever format you wantin it  
12:30 <+lucaa> I understand  
12:30 <+lucaa> it just creates complexity  
12:30 <vmassol> but we have a xwiki-rendering-xwiki module  
12:30 <vmassol> which has XWiki-related code  
12:30 <vmassol> so we can easily add some helper code there  
12:31 <vmassol> to return DR instead of a String  
12:31 <vmassol> for source for ex  
12:31 <vmassol> but you'll still need to know that ;)  
12:31 <+lucaa> well first, we need an API to return the source :)  
12:31 <vmassol> we have that  
12:31 <vmassol> but yes what we need is an  api to return the closest source  
12:31 <+lucaa> in a macro I mean

16:36 <+lucaa> guys, how do I parse a piece of wiki syntax without getting a paragraph around it?  
16:36 <+lucaa> I just want the result as a list of Block  
16:37 <@sdumitriu> Remove the first paragraph  
16:37 <+tmortagne> lucaa: ParserUtils.removeTopLevelParagraph  
16:37 <@sdumitriu> From the result  
16:38 <+tmortagne> that's what we use currently  
16:38 <+lucaa> ahaa  
16:38 <+lucaa> ok  
16:38 <+lucaa> thanks  
16:38 <+tmortagne> (until we have inline parsers, some day..)  
16:38 <+lucaa> and it only removes it if it's there, right?  
16:38 <+tmortagne> if ((blocks.size() == 1) && blocks.get(0) instanceof ParagraphBlock) {  
16:38 <+tmortagne>             Block paragraphBlock = blocks.remove(0);  
16:38 <+tmortagne>             blocks.addAll(0, paragraphBlock.getChildren());  
16:38 <+tmortagne>         }  
16:38 <+lucaa> found it  
16:39 <+lucaa> now  
16:39 <+lucaa> how do I use this? new ParserUtils() ?  
16:39 <+tmortagne> yep  
16:39 <+lucaa> it doesn't seem to be static...  
16:39 <+lucaa> ok  
16:42 <+lucaa> thanks tmortagne  
16:42 <+tmortagne> lucaa: np
